intro: Justicia claessensii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically has velvety, dark green leaves and produces clusters of blooms during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom continuously under proper care.
